name: Cutting Dubs
description:
Welcome to the Codewars Vinyl Cutting and Pressing Plant! This is the place to come to press your next hot EP or LP onto vinyl or dubplate. 

# BACKGROUND:

When pressing vinyl, there are a few key things to consider: Cost, Loudness and Quality.

There are 3 sizes of vinyl records: 7", 10" and 12". The smaller the disc, the lower the cost. 

There are 2 speeds that vinyl records can play at: 33.3rpm and 45rpm. Records played at slower speeds have longer maximum runtimes, as shown below:
```
12" @33 1/3 RPM                           12" @45 RPM:
OPTIMAL - 20< minutes per side 	       OPTIMAL - 12< minutes per side
MAXIMUM - 25 minutes per side 	        MAXIMUM - 15 minutes per side

10" @33 1/3 RPM 	                      10" @45 RPM
OPTIMAL - 9< minutes per side 	        OPTIMAL - 8< minutes per side
MAXIMUM - 14 minutes per side 	        MAXIMUM - 10 minutes per side

7" @33 1/3 RPM (not recommended) 	     7" @45 RPM
OPTIMAL - 5< minutes per side 	        OPTIMAL - 3< minutes per side
MAXIMUM - 7 minutes per side              MAXIMUM - 5 minutes per side
```
(http://www.chicagomasteringservice.com/vinyl.html)

In order to achieve the best Loudness, we will always recommend an 'optimal' pressing.

Moreover, faster playback speeds result in higher audio Quality. Hence, we will always recommend to press a record to 45rpm over 33.3rpm.

Also, we will never recommend a 7 inch vinyl pressing at 33.3rpm. 

# YOUR TASK:

We're currently adding a new feature to our website - an automatically-generated recommendation for vinyl pressings. 

Given two arrays of user-submitted track durations (representing Side A and Side B), create a function that returns the recommended pressing setup.

This recommendation must be an array containing:

 - Two nested arrays, listing the track durations on each side of the record in their original order.
 - The recommended size
 - The recommended speed
 
The recommendation should:

  - ALWAYS recommend an OPTIMAL pressing, whenever possible.
  - Be as cheap as possible, but prioritise loudness and audio quality over cost
  - Account for a 5-second gap between tracks 
  - Use both sides of the vinyl if possible. 
     - If one side of the record contains 2+ tracks and the other side 0 tracks, put the longest track on the empty side. 
     - If the array contains only a single track, it should be pressed on side A.
     - An empty side of vinyl should return an empty array. 
  - Reject records whereby one or both sides exceed the maximum runtime (return -1).
      


# NOTES:
The record must contain at least 1 track.
The track times are provided in minutes and seconds, like so: "MM:SS". 
There are no audio gaps before the first track, or after the last track.

# EXAMPLE:

``` javascript
function myNewHitRecord([["3:30", "5:00"], ["7:00"]]) => [["3:30", "5:00"], ["7:00"], 12, 45]
```
  (Side A = 7 mins; Side B = 8.5 mins; There are two Optimal settings, but by prioritising quality over cost, our recommended size and speed is 12 inches and 45rpm.)

Good luck!
